meanings.definition: To take out or up with or as if with a scoop
meanings.sent1: She scouped the ice cream into a cone.
meanings.sent2: The child scouped sand into a bucket at the beach.
meanings.sent3: He scouped up the spilled milk with a napkin.
meanings.sent4: The excavator scouped out a large hole in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The chef scouped out the avocado flesh with precision.

meanings.definition: To hollow out or form with a scoop
meanings.sent1: She scouped out a pumpkin to make a jack-o'-lantern.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor scouped the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: He scouped a hole in the sand to bury his treasure.
meanings.sent4: The machine scouped the snow to clear the driveway.
meanings.sent5: The chef scouped the melon into decorative balls.

meanings.definition: To pick up quickly or surreptitiously with or as if with a scoop
meanings.sent1: She scouped up the fallen coins before anyone noticed.
meanings.sent2: The cat scouped up the mouse in one swift motion.
meanings.sent3: He scouped up the last cookie when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The spy scouped up the classified documents without a sound.
meanings.sent5: The child scouped up the candy from the jar when no one was around.

meanings.definition: To move or lift with a scoop or as if with a scoop
meanings.sent1: She scouped the baby into her arms and kissed his forehead.
meanings.sent2: The crane scouped the heavy load effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: He scouped the books off the table and onto the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The wind scouped the leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent5: The chef scouped the pasta onto the plate with a flourish.
